item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "She was clean": no piercings, tattoos, or scarifications. All the kids were now. And who could blame them, Alex thought, after watching three generations of flaccid tattoos droop like moth-eaten upholstery over poorly stuffed biceps and saggy asses?" -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Greebs add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Stories only happen to those who are able to tell them." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "Like all failed experiments, that one taught me something I didn’t expect: one key ingredient of so-called experience is the delusional faith that it is unique and special, that those included in it are privileged and those excluded from it are missing out." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "The pause makes you think the song will end. And then the song isn't really over, so you're relieved. But then the song does actually end, because every song ends, obviously, and THAT. TIME. THE. END. IS. FOR. REAL." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "Each of us, deep down, believes that the whole world issues from his own precious body, like images projected from a tiny slide onto an earth-sized screen. And then, deeper down, each of us knows he’s wrong." -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "You told me once that a soul isn't something a person is born with but something that must be built, by effort and error, study and love. And you did that with more dedication than most, that work of building a soul-not for your own benefit but for the benefit of those that knew you." -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Taking crazy things seriously is a serious waste of time." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "What happens when people open their hearts?"... "They get better." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jess Walter
item.description: "This is what happens when you live in dreams, he thought: you dream this and you dream that and you sleep right through your life." -- Jess Walter

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jess Walter
item.description: "She saw death as just another wedding she wasn't invited to." -- Jess Walter

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jess Walter
item.description: "She was asleep, that blond hair swirled like butter on the pillow beneath her" -- Jess Walter

item.title: Greebs add a quote by Jess Walter
item.description: "Being alive isn't the same thing as living" -- Jess Walter

item.title: Greebs add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin
